help.title: User Guide & Help
help.welcome: Welcome to Visual Editor for Experiment Scripts!
help.welcomeText: This platform helps you create, edit, and share detailed experiment scripts for educational purposes.
help.step1Desc: Click "Create New Experiment" button on the dashboard.
help.step2Desc: Enter experiment title, description, and select relevant sections (materials, procedure, safety, etc.).
help.step3Desc: Fill each section with text, images, videos, and other media. Use the rich text editor for formatting.
help.step4Desc: Save your work regularly. Use the preview button to see how your experiment will look.
help.step5Desc: Export your experiment as PDF or HTML to share with students or colleagues.
help.experimentCreationDesc: Create comprehensive experiment scripts with multiple sections:
help.mediaSupportDesc: Add visual aids to enhance understanding:
help.exportOptionsDesc: Share your experiments in multiple formats:
help.sharingPermissionsDesc: Control who can access your experiments with three visibility modes:
help.aiAssistantDesc: Your intelligent co-pilot for creating better experiments:
help.draftManagementDesc: Never lose your work with automatic draft saving:
help.tip1Desc: Click the "Save" button regularly to avoid losing your work. The system auto-saves periodically, but manual saves ensure your latest changes are preserved.
help.tip2Desc: If you need to leave while creating an experiment, just close the wizard. Your draft is automatically saved and you can continue later by clicking "Continue Draft" on the dashboard.
help.tip3Desc: Always include safety measures and hazard information at the beginning. This ensures students are aware of precautions before starting.
help.tip4Desc: Break down procedures into clear, numbered steps. Add notes or warnings for critical steps.
help.tip5Desc: Include diagrams, photos, and videos to make complex procedures easier to understand. A picture is worth a thousand words!
help.tip6Desc: Always preview your experiment before exporting to check formatting, images, and content flow.
help.tip7Desc: Create new versions when making major changes. This allows you to track improvements and revert if needed.
help.tipPermissionsDesc: Start with Private mode for work-in-progress experiments. Switch to Public when ready to share openly, or use Restricted mode to control specific features. Remember: you can always change permissions later!
help.tipAIDesc: The AI assistant knows YOUR experiment context. Ask specific questions like "What safety measures should I add for sodium hydroxide?" instead of generic questions. The more specific you are, the better the suggestions!
help.tipReviewDesc: Always run the Content Review feature before exporting or sharing. It catches missing sections, incomplete safety information, and inconsistencies that you might have missed.
help.q1: How do I add a new section to my experiment?
help.a1: During experiment creation, you can select from predefined sections (materials, procedure, safety, etc.) or create custom sections by clicking "Add Custom Section" and entering a name.
help.q2: Can I upload my own images and videos?
help.a2: Yes! Each section has a media upload button where you can add images and videos. Supported formats include JPG, PNG, GIF for images and MP4, WebM for videos.
help.q3: How do I export my experiment as PDF?
help.a3: Open your experiment in view mode, click the "Export" button, and select "Export as PDF". The system will generate a formatted PDF including all text, images, and safety icons.
help.q4: What happens if I make a mistake?
help.a4: You can always edit your experiment and save a new version. The version history feature allows you to compare versions and restore previous ones if needed.
help.q5: Can I collaborate with others on an experiment?
help.a5: Currently, each experiment is owned by one user. However, you can export and share the HTML/PDF version with colleagues who can use it as a template for their own experiments.
help.q6: How do I add procedure steps?
help.a6: In the Procedure section, click "Add Step". Enter the step description and optionally add notes or warnings. Steps are automatically numbered. You can reorder steps by dragging them.
help.q7: Where can I find safety icons?
help.a7: In the Safety Measures section, click "Add Safety Icon" to open the icon library. You can select from GHS hazard pictograms and safety equipment icons. Selected icons will appear in your experiment.
help.a8: Yes! Use the language switcher in the top navigation bar to toggle between English and German. Your experiment content remains unchanged, but the interface labels will change.
help.q9: How do I control who can access my experiment?
help.a9: During experiment creation, go to the "Sharing & Access" step. Choose from three options:
help.q10: What happens if I set my experiment to Restricted?
help.a10: Other users will see disabled (grayed out) buttons for features you haven't allowed. For example, if you disable "Edit", they can view but cannot modify the experiment. You always have full access as the creator.
help.q10b: Why are some buttons grayed out when I view an experiment?
help.a10b: Grayed-out (disabled) buttons mean the experiment creator has restricted that feature. This is intentional - they want you to view the experiment but not use certain features like editing, exporting, or deleting.
help.q11: How do I use the AI Assistant?
help.a11: Click the chat icon in the bottom-right corner while creating or editing an experiment. The AI knows your experiment context and can answer questions, suggest improvements, or help with missing sections. Try asking: "What's missing in my experiment?" or "Help me improve the safety section."
help.q12: Can I simplify my experiment for younger students?
help.a12: Yes! Open your experiment, click the menu (three dots), and select "Simplify Language". Choose the target grade level, and AI will rewrite the content to match that comprehension level. This creates a new version, so your original is preserved.
help.q13: What if I accidentally close the experiment wizard?
help.a13: Don't worry! Your work is automatically saved as a draft. Return to the dashboard, and the "Create New Experiment" button will show "Continue Draft". Click it to resume exactly where you left off.
help.q14: How do I check if my experiment is complete?
help.a14: Click the "Review Content" button in the wizard or experiment editor. The system will check for missing fields, incomplete sections, and consistency issues. You'll get a detailed report with suggestions for improvements.

wizard.backgroundHelp: Provide context and theory students need to understand before starting
wizard.materialsHelp: List all equipment, chemicals, and supplies needed
wizard.safetyHelp: Include all safety warnings, precautions, and required protective equipment
wizard.procedureHelp: Write clear, numbered steps students should follow
wizard.observationsHelp: Describe what students should observe and record during the experiment
wizard.resultsHelp: Explain how to analyze and interpret the data collected
wizard.conclusionsHelp: Guide students in drawing conclusions and connecting to learning objectives
wizard.discussionHelp: Add questions for critical thinking and deeper understanding
wizard.referencesHelp: Cite sources, textbooks, or additional reading materials
wizard.sectionOptional: This section is optional - you can skip it or add it later
wizard.sectionRequired: This section is required for a complete experiment
wizard.sectionRecommended: This section is highly recommended for student understanding
wizard.addMediaHelp: Upload images or videos to illustrate procedures and expected results
wizard.richTextHelp: Use formatting tools: Bold for emphasis, lists for steps, headings for organization
wizard.polishAllHelp: AI will review and improve all your content for clarity and scientific accuracy
wizard.checkConsistencyHelp: AI will verify that terminology and content are consistent across sections
wizard.addCustomSection: Create your own section with a custom name and description
wizard.publicPermissionHelp: Everyone can view this experiment - Great for sharing with the wider community
wizard.privatePermissionHelp: Only you can access this experiment - Ideal while still developing content
wizard.restrictedPermissionHelp: Control exactly who can access and what they can do - Best for collaborative work
wizard.previewHelp: Review your complete experiment before creating it - You can still edit after creation
